title: 70s "groovy" script + heavy italic
content:
Hi,

I am trying to find these two fonts. The first is a 70s style script, from a car spray paint touch up paint can. I thought it was Banana Split, but it's not. The second is a heavy italic font. The brand is Spanish if that helps at all.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417225417im_/http:/typophile.com/files/touch-up_5621.jpg)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417225417im_/http:/typophile.com/files/mtn-mtn_3841.jpg)
author: h johnston

comments.content: For the script the closest I can think of is [Candice](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417225417/http:/new.myfonts.com/search/candice/fonts/).

You might want to check out this font -- [http://www.youworkforthem.com/product.php?sku=T0120](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417225417/http:/www.youworkforthem.com/product.php?sku=T0120). Not the same, but I've seen Candace used way too much and this typeface has some nice alternates.
...or [Groovin’](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417225417/http:/www.veer.com/products/typedetail.aspx?image=JBT0000076), which is a digitized version of Gaston.
Yes, Groovin’ – and they used the V instead of the U. ;^D
